page.description: list and methods that can be used on the client-side to interact with UX components.

property.name: _dataSeriesData
property.description: Object containing data series that have been published to the client. See the [Publish data to client-side] UX Component property to learn more. Has the following properties:

property.name: <SeriesName>
property.description: Contains the data in a series. Replace <SeriesName> with the name of the series. E.g. *[js:{dialog.object}._dataSeriesData.Names]*. If the series does not have a named subseries, the object will be an array. Otherwise, <SeriesName> will contain one or more subseries properties containing the data in the series:

property.name: <SubSeries1>
property.description: A CR-LF delimited string of values for a data series sub-series. Replace <SubSeries1> with the name of the subseries. E.g. *[js:{dialog.object}._dataSeriesData.Names.Firstname]*

property.name: <SubSeriesN>
property.description: One or more additional properties containing a CR-LF delimited string of values for a data series sub-series. Replace <SubSeriesN> with the name of the subseries. E.g. *[js:{dialog.object}._dataSeriesData.Names.Lastname]*

property.name: _localStorageSettings
property.description: Local storage settings for the UX Component.

property.name: dialogId
property.description: The UX Component name. Equivalent to {dialog.componentName}. Prefer to use {dialog.componentName}.

property.name: stateInfo
property.description: A JSON object containing state information. Can be used to read and set state information for the component. See also [getStateInfo()] and [setStateInfo()].

section.title: Placeholders
section.description: Placeholders are dynamic objects that can be used JavaScript code to reference objects that are defined by the Application Server.

item.name: {dialog.ComponentName}
item.description: Gets replaced with the alias of the UX Component. For example, if the UX alias is 'DLG1', then is replaced with 'DLG1'.

item.name: {dialog.ControlIdEscaped}
item.description: The control Id of the control. Special characters in the id are Javascript escaped. You must use this placeholder (and not {dialog.ControlId}) if you want to use this placeholder in a selector (such as JQuery - jQuery('#{dialog.controlIDEscaped}') )

item.name: {dialog.ControlId}
item.description: The control Id of the control. Note: See comment on {dialog.ControlIDEscaped}.

item.name: {dialog.EmbeddedCustomComponent_[Alias]}
item.description: Used to get the Object name of an embedded Custom Component. Replace [Alias] with the alias you specified for the embedded Custom Component object. You can use this placeholder to execute methods on the embedded Custom Component.

item.name: {dialog.EmbeddedUX_[UXAlias]}
item.description: Used to get the Object name of an embedded UX Component. Replace [UXAlias] with the alias you specified for the embedded UX object. You can use this placeholder to execute methods on the embedded UX.

item.name: {dialog.EmbeddedGrid_[GridAlias]}
item.description: Used to get the Object name of an embedded Grid Component. Replace [GridAlias] with the alias you specified for the embedded Grid object. You can use this placeholder to execute methods on the embedded Grid.

item.name: {dialog.listId}
item.description: For use with the List control. Gets replaced with the ID of the current List control.

item.name: {dialog.object}
item.description: Gets replaced with the name of the Javascript UX Component Object. For example, if the UX alias is 'DLG1', then is replaced with 'DLG1_DlgObj'. Use this placeholder when you want to call a method of the UX Object. e.g. {Dialog.Object}.submit(), to submit the UX to the server.

item.name: {dialog.Style}
item.description: Gets replaced with the style name of the UX. For example, if the style is 'GlassOlive', then gets replaced with 'GlassOlive'.

link.link: ux properties publish data to client side property
